com.augursystems.armi.demo

Class ServerService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.augursystems.armi.demo.ServerService

  • public class ServerService
extends java.lang.Object
    This is instantiated as a service when the Armi is started from the command line. (If Armi is started programmatically, then that server instance's methods can be called directly.)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String hello()
      This is a method that may be called by an ARMI client
      java.lang.String hello(java.lang.String arg)
      This is a method that may be called by an ARMI client
      java.util.ArrayList listServices() 
      java.util.ArrayList listSubscriptions() 
      java.lang.String shutdown()
      This is no-argument option to shutdown the server; only works if the server password was not set.
      java.lang.String shutdown(java.lang.String password)
      This is password-protected option to shutdown the server; only works if the server password was set and matches.
      void waitForShutdown()
      This method will block until the ARMI server is well on its way (past the point of no return) for a complete shutdown.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

        public java.lang.String hello()
        This is a method that may be called by an ARMI client

      • listServices

        public java.util.ArrayList listServices()

      • listSubscriptions

        public java.util.ArrayList listSubscriptions()

      • waitForShutdown

        public void waitForShutdown()
        This method will block until the ARMI server is well on its way (past the point of no return) for a complete shutdown. The caller may receive an exception since the call probably won't be able to cleanly return, but that should be expected, and taken as a positive indication of shutdown.

      • shutdown

        public java.lang.String shutdown()
        This is no-argument option to shutdown the server; only works if the server password was not set.

      • shutdown

        public java.lang.String shutdown(java.lang.String password)
        This is password-protected option to shutdown the server; only works if the server password was set and matches.
